author: Olena Mukhina
title: Canada to continue to stand with Ukraine in face of Russia‚Äôs invasion, says deputy PM - Euromaidan Press
text: Ukraine can count on further unwavering support from Canada, said Deputy Prime Minister Chrystia Freeland. ‚ÄúThe brave people of Ukraine are fighting for their democracy and freedom ‚Äì but they are also on the front lines fighting for us all. Canadians will continue to stand with Ukraine in the face of Russia‚Äôs illegal invasion,‚Äù Freeland wrote on X. The brave people of Ukraine are fighting for their democracy and freedom ‚Äì but they are also on the front lines fighting for us all. Canadians will continue to stand with Ukraine in the face of Russia‚Äôs illegal invasion. [pic.twitter.com/6HOwo1YewM] ‚Äî Chrystia Freeland (@cafreeland) [January 19, 2024] Canada has been a long- supporter of Ukraine as the country continues to fight off Russian aggression. Canada plans to allocate more than $940 billion in aid for Ukraine until 2026, according to the [2023 Fall Economic Statement](https://budget.canada.ca/fes-eea/2023/report-rapport/FES-EEA-2023-en.pdf). The Canadian government will send over $595 million to Ukraine in 2023-2024, $232 million in 2024-2025, and $143 million in 2025-2026. The statement by the Canadian Deputy prime minister came after a meeting with Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba. Both parties discussed the implementation of mechanisms for using frozen Russian assets to help Ukraine. ‚ÄúDuring our meeting, Canada‚Äôs Deputy PM and Finance Minister @cafreeland and I focused on the use of frozen Russian assets to support Ukraine. This is a morally, politically, and legally right thing to do. Steps must be taken collectively and swiftly by the G7 and the EU,‚Äù Kuleba said on X. During our meeting, Canada‚Äôs Deputy PM and Finance Minister [@cafreeland]and I focused on the use of frozen Russian assets to support Ukraine. This is a morally, politically, and legally right thing to do. Steps must be taken collectively and swiftly by G7 and the EU. [pic.twitter.com/beyMB5Ob02] ‚Äî Dmytro Kuleba (@DmytroKuleba) [January 18, 2024] At the end of April 2022, the US House of Representatives had approved a bill on the confiscation of frozen assets owned by Russian sanctioned entities and individuals. The seized funds had been proposed to be directed towards providing additional military and humanitarian aid to Ukraine. In December 2023, the US proposed a plan to its G7 allies to confiscate $300 billion in Russian assets. In its turn, Russia denounced the freeze as a violation of the basic principles of reserve security, and hired international law firms, and commissioned expert views to defend its interests in [courts](https://euromaidanpress.com/2024/01/12/bloomberg-russia-braces-for-legal-battle-over-its-frozen-assets/). Related: [White House: US aid to Ukraine stopped while Russian strikes only intensify](https://euromaidanpress.com/2024/01/12/white-house-us-aid-to-ukraine-stopped-while-russian-strikes-only-intensify/?swcfpc=1) [Biden: ‚ÄúFailure to support Ukraine is just absolutely crazy‚Äù](https://euromaidanpress.com/2023/12/06/biden-failure-to-support-ukraine-is-just-absolutely-crazy/?swcfpc=1) [Biden calls on Congress to ‚Äústand with Ukraine‚Äù as Putin ‚Äúbanking on‚Äù US aid failure](https://euromaidanpress.com/2023/12/13/biden-calls-on-congress-to-stand-with-ukraine-as-putin-banking-on-us-aid-failure/?swcfpc=1) [FT: G7 working groups explore options to confiscate Russian assets](https://euromaidanpress.com/2023/12/28/ft-g7-working-froups-explore-options-to-confiscate-russian-assets/?swcfpc=1) [G7 nations lean towards seizing Russian assets](https://euromaidanpress.com/2023/12/16/g7-nations-lean-towards-seizing-russian-assets/?swcfpc=1) [US Congress approves bill on transfer of Russia‚Äôs frozen assets to Ukraine](https://euromaidanpress.com/2023/11/08/media-us-congress-approves-bill-on-transfer-of-russias-frozen-assets-to-ukraine/?swcfpc=1)

author: Saleen Martin
title: 'May this keep you safe from harm': WWII era Bible returned to New York veteran's family
text: Lost Bible returned to slain USAAF airman from World War II [Saleen Martin](https://www.usatoday.com/staff/7245115001/saleen-martin/) During World War II, a woman bought three brothers Bibles to protect their hearts and guide them as they set out for battle. The Bible had a metal cover on the front with the inscription ‚ÄúMay this keep you safe from harm." Two of the brothers made it home, while the other, Lt. Edsel J. McKnight of the United States Army Air Forces, was shot down off the coast of France. His Bible was mailed to the family but was lost sometime after. This month, his family finally got it back. Ava Coogan's family is from Albany, New York and they found the Bible in late December while going through their late matriarch‚Äôs belongings. On Jan. 11, Coogan met Lt. McKnight‚Äôs sister-in-law and returned the Bible to her, allowing her to put it back in its rightful place, next to the ones his brothers brought back home from war. ‚ÄòI kept playing with it and flipping through the pages‚Äô Coogan‚Äôs uncle and mother found the Bible in a stack of books. Their mother, Rosanne Vartanian, died nearly 20 years ago but was a collector and loved garage sales. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs just so random that my grandmother had the urge to pick that up,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúShe bought random things. There was no rhyme or reason to it. It was with a stack of other books.‚Äù Coogan decided to research the Bible and found out soldiers often took them to war. Some can be found in museums. ‚ÄúThe whole premise of it was that the metal cover on the front is like a hard shield,‚Äù Coogan told USA TODAY. ‚ÄúThey would put it in their coat pockets ‚Ä¶ like the front breast pocket ‚Ä¶ that cover would protect their heart from bullets.‚Äù Lt. McKnight‚Äôs name was also written in the Bible, said Coogan, who was drawn to the Bible for some reason. She couldn‚Äôt put it down, she recalled. ‚ÄúI kept playing with it and flipping through the pages,‚Äù she said. She noticed that the Bible‚Äôs front cover had a slice in it, almost like something was underneath it. She examined it more closely and found a piece of paper folded up inside. She asked her uncle for help, who carefully used a butter knife to get the slip of paper out. Once they retrieved the piece of paper from under the Bible‚Äôs cover, they saw that it was a plea for the Bible‚Äôs safe return to an address not too far away. Although there was no area code, there was a phone number listed, so the family added their own area code and called. ‚ÄúI was just hoping for the best,‚Äù Coogan said. ‚ÄúWe found out that number worked.‚Äù Lieutenant was shot down off the coast of France When Coogan called the number written in the note, she spoke to a woman named Fay, Lt. McKnight‚Äôs sister-in-law. They organized a meetup on Jan. 11 to return the Bible to the family, who is from Porter Corners, part of Saratoga County in eastern New York. Lt. McKnight served in the U.S. Air Force‚Äôs 365th Fighter Group and 388th Fighter Squadron. He was flying in a Thunderbolt fighter aircraft in 1944 when he was shot down off the coast of France, [online records](https://rafbeaulieu.co.uk/honouring-the-airmen-of-raf-beaulieu/) show. Fay told Coogan and her family that Lt. McKnight has two brothers. All three of the brothers served in WWII. Fay‚Äôs husband, Ray, said his Bible saved his life. ‚ÄúHe got shot during the war and it hit where the Bible was, covering his heart, and the bullet went into his arm instead,‚Äù Coogan said. Once Lt. McKnight was killed, his belongings were shipped back home to the family. His sister-in-law had all three Bibles on a bookshelf on display. One day, the family was preparing to go to church. Her nephew borrowed the Bible, but knew it was so precious, the family decided to write a note with contact information in case it were ever lost. ‚ÄúHe didn't lose it,‚Äù Coogan said. ‚ÄúHe brought it back after church and I guess what happened is after someone passed in their family, they had an estate sale ‚Ä¶ and it just accidentally went out with a stack of books.‚Äù It ended up in Coogan‚Äôs grandmother‚Äôs hands, she said. Returning the Bible to the McKnight family was quite the enlightening experience, Coogan said. ‚ÄúThat was really cool because that's when we kind of got to hear their story,‚Äù she said.

author: /author/ani/
title: Taiwan detects 41 Chinese aircraft, seven vessels around its nation - www.lokmattimes.com
text: Taiwan detects 41 Chinese aircraft, seven vessels around its nation By [ANI](/author/ani/) | Published: August 23, 2024 08:07 AM2024-08-23T08:07:39+5:302024-08-23T08:10:04+5:30 Taipei [Taiwan], August 23 : Taiwan detected 41 Chinese aircraft and seven Chinese vessels around its territory till 6am ... Taipei [Taiwan], August 23 : Taiwan detected 41 Chinese aircraft and seven Chinese vessels around its territory till 6am on Friday, Taiwan's Ministry of Defence stated. The defence ministry stated that 32 aircraft crossed the median line and entered Taiwan's Eastern Air Defence Identification Zone (ADIZ). Following this, Taipei monitored the situation and responded accordingly. "41 PLA aircraft and 7 PLAN vessels operating around Taiwan were detected up until 6 a.m. (UTC+8) today. 32 of the aircraft crossed the median line and entered Taiwan's northern, southwestern and eastern ADIZ. ROC Armed Forces have monitored the situation and responded accordingly." 41 PLA aircraft and 7 PLAN vessels operating around Taiwan were detected up until 6 a.m. (UTC+8) today. 32 of the aircraft crossed the median line and entered Taiwan's northern, southwestern and eastern ADIZ. #ROCArmedForces have monitored the situation and responded accordingly. pic.twitter.com/dQyTSDMsVX‚Äî ÂúãÈò≤ÈÉ® Ministry of National Defense, R.O.C. üáπüáº (@MoNDefense) August 23, 2024 Earlier on Thursday, the Taiwanese MND detected eight PLA (People's Liberation Army) aircraft and six PLAN (People's Liberation Army Navy) vessels around its territory. The MND stated that three aircraft crossed the median line and entered Taiwan's Eastern Air Defence Identification Zone (ADIZ). In a post on X, the MND stated, "8 PLA aircraft and 6 PLAN vessels operating around Taiwan were detected up until 6 a.m. (UTC+8). 3 of the aircraft crossed the median line and entered Taiwan's southwestern and eastern ADIZ. ROC Armed Forces have monitored the situation and responded accordingly." 8 PLA aircraft and 6 PLAN vessels operating around Taiwan were detected up until 6 a.m. (UTC+8) today. 3 of the aircraft crossed the median line and entered Taiwan's southwestern and eastern ADIZ. #ROCArmedForces have monitored the situation and responded accordingly. pic.twitter.com/lDNYbdxVfu‚Äî ÂúãÈò≤ÈÉ® Ministry of National Defense, R.O.C. üáπüáº (@MoNDefense) August 22, 2024 This latest incident adds to a series of similar provocations by China in recent months. China has increased its military activities around Taiwan, including regular air and naval incursions into Taiwan's ADIZ and military exercises near the island. Notably, Taiwan has been governed independently since 1949. However, China considers Taiwan part of its territory and insists on eventual reunification, by force if necessary. So far this month, Taiwan has tracked over 300 PLA aircraft and around 200 Chinese ships. Since September 2020, China has increased its use of grey zone tactics by incrementally increasing the number of military aircraft and naval vessels operating around Taiwan. Disclaimer: This post has been auto-published from an agency feed without any modifications to the text and has not been reviewed by an editor [Open in app](https://www.lokmattimes.com/install_app.htm?utm_source=www.lokmattimes.com&utm_medium=open_in_app&launch_url=https://www.lokmattimes.com/international/taiwan-detects-41-chinese-aircraft-seven-vessels-around-its-nation/)

author: @ElUniversal_SLP
title: Proyecto de tren de pasajeros de Claudia Sheinbaum incluir√° a SLP
text:
Gobierno del estado celebra que San Luis Potos√≠ sea parte del retorno del tren de pasajeros , as√≠ lo afirm√≥ el secretario general de gobierno, Guadalupe Torres , esto luego de que el pasado mi√©rcoles la virtual presidenta electa, Claudia Sheinbaum anunci√≥ que al iniciar su gesti√≥n llegar√° el proyecto para la construcci√≥n del tren que ir√° desde Ciudad de M√©xico a Nuevo Laredo , el cual constar√° de mil 134 kil√≥metros de recorrido, pasando por la entidad. El secretario general de gobierno J. Guadalupe Torres S√°nchez consider√≥ que San Luis Potos√≠ debe sentirse privilegiado al ser incluido dentro de las primeras y principales obras de infraestructura que impulsar√° la virtual presidenta electa Claudia Sheinbaum Pardo.
Torres S√°nchez refiri√≥ ‚Äúesto coloca a San Luis Potos√≠ en una situaci√≥n distinta al resto del pa√≠s porque generar√° m√°s movilidad, nos coloca en una situaci√≥n privilegiada en varios sentidos, como es el caso del turismo, desarrollo econ√≥mico, en temas sociales incluso porque seguramente ser√° un medio de transporte barato‚Ä¶ nos sentimos afortunados de que as√≠ sea‚Äù.
¬øRegresar√° el tren de pasajeros a SLP?, te contamos sobre el proyecto
El segundo al mando de la administraci√≥n estatal admiti√≥ desconocer mayores detalles sobre el proyecto, como es el caso de cuantas estaciones se ubicar√≠an en territorio potosino, sin embargo, tan pronto se vaya a teniendo mayor informaci√≥n se ir√° compartiendo, pero dijo confiar en que sean varios puntos en donde haya estaciones de este nuevo tren en San Luis Potos√≠.
Dijo adem√°s que, esto tiene otros beneficios adicionales, puesto que sigue la misma ruta que la carretera 57 que actualmente est√° ya saturada, pues esto despresurizar√° en gran medida la movilidad de personas entre el norte y el centro del pa√≠s, adem√°s de que se plantea que sea un tren el√©ctrico por tanto tambi√©n habr√° menor contaminaci√≥n.
Finalmente admiti√≥ que, tal como ha sucedido en otros casos como recientemente en el conflicto que hubo entre la empresa ferroviaria Canadian Pacific- Kansas City Southern (CP-KCSM) con colonos de las terceras en el norte de la capital potosina, el gobierno estatal intervendr√° como mediador para llegar a acuerdos con comunidades, empresas o cualquier persona que en determinado momento pudiera sentirse afectada por la construcci√≥n de este nuevo medio de transporte.
Lee m√°s: Claudia Sheinbaum presenta a L√°zaro C√°rdenas Batel como jefe de Oficina de Presidencia
¬øCu√°ndo comenzar√° la construcci√≥n del tren de pasajeros en SLP? De acuerdo a la propia Claudia Sheinbaum en una reciente comparecencia ante medios informativos, el tren M√©xico- Nuevo Laredo ser√° el primer proyecto de infraestructura que estar√° impulsando, con la idea de incluso lanzar la licitaci√≥n en cuanto tome posesi√≥n es decir en este mes de octubre de 2024.
¬øCu√°l ser√≠a la inversi√≥n y cu√°nto tardar√° su construcci√≥n? Asimismo, la pr√≥xima presidenta detall√≥ en su presentaci√≥n que esta ruta de m√°s de Mil 200 kil√≥metros que unir√° el centro de M√©xico con la frontera norte, requerir√° una inversi√≥n de unos 400 mil millones de pesos, la idea es que pueda operarse a trav√©s de una concesi√≥n con la propia (CP-KCSM) ya que correr√≠a por su mismo derecho de v√≠a, adem√°s de que tendr√° un tiempo de ejecuci√≥n de aproximadamente cinco a√±os.
Buscar√≠an incluir a San Luis en proyecto de tren de pasajeros M√©xico- Quer√©taro
¬øQu√© municipios de SLP recorrer√° el tren de pasajeros? Cabe destacar que, actualmente la v√≠a f√©rrea que forma parte de la ruta M√©xico-Laredo que cruza por la entidad potosina y que es utilizada para el transporte de carga por parte de (CP-KCS) atraviesa de sur a norte los municipios de Villa de Reyes, San Luis Potos√≠ capital, Moctezuma, Venado, Charcas, Real de Catorce y Vanegas.

author: AnaCGuaita
title: R√©gimen de Ortega sigue arremetiendo contra la Iglesia cat√≥lica: tres sacerdotes detenidos en solo 24 horas
text:
El sacerdote nicarag√ºense Fernando Calero fue detenido por la Polic√≠a, con lo que suman tres los curas encarcelados en las √∫ltimas 24 horas, denunci√≥ este viernes la abogada e investigadora nicarag√ºense exiliada Martha Patricia Molina.
‚ÄúPolic√≠a sandinista secuestra al sacerdote Fernando Calero, p√°rroco de Nuestra Se√±ora de F√°tima (en el municipio de) Rancho Grande, (departamento de Matagalpa). Se desconoce su paradero‚Äù, se√±al√≥ Molina, autora del estudio titulado ‚ÄòNicaragua: ¬øUna Iglesia perseguida?‚Äô, a trav√©s de su cuenta de la red social X (antes Twitter).
Seg√∫n la investigadora, Calero fue ‚Äúsecuestrado por la Polic√≠a Nacional en su parroquia‚Äù tras haber mencionado al obispo encarcelado Rolando √Ålvarez, quien preside la Di√≥cesis de Matagalpa, en una misa.
‚ÄúNo existe una acusaci√≥n formal en contra de √©l y no se tiene informaci√≥n de su paradero‚Äù, explic√≥.
Calero se suma a los sacerdotes Carlos Avil√©s y H√©ctor Treminio, vicario general y tesorero de la Arquidi√≥cesis de Managua, respectivamente, que fueron detenidos el jueves por la Polic√≠a y civiles.
La semana pasada, las autoridades detuvieron al obispo Isidoro Mora, a dos sacerdotes y a dos seminaristas.
Ni el Gobierno ni la Polic√≠a Nacional han confirmado o negado la presunta detenci√≥n de los religiosos.
El cardenal nicarag√ºense y arzobispo de Managua, Leopoldo Brenes, a√∫n no se pronuncia sobre esos arrestos.
Quien s√≠ lo hizo fue el exiliado obispo auxiliar de Managua, Silvio B√°ez, a quien el papa Francisco orden√≥ dejar Nicaragua en 2019 por motivos de seguridad, quien se declar√≥ indignado por los encarcelamientos de tres sacerdotes de la Arquidi√≥cesis de Managua.
Dos obispos, cinco sacerdotes y dos seminaristas presos
En el caso de Mora, obispo de la Di√≥cesis de Siuna, en el Caribe de Nicaragua, fue arrestado un d√≠a despu√©s de mencionar en una homil√≠a al obispo Rolando √Ålvarez, condenado en febrero pasado a m√°s de 26 a√±os de prisi√≥n por delitos considerados traici√≥n a la patria tras negarse a abandonar su pa√≠s.
Mora es el segundo obispo detenido en Nicaragua. El primero fue √Ålvarez, quien el 10 de febrero pasado fue condenado a 26 a√±os y 4 meses de prisi√≥n, despojado de su nacionalidad, y suspendidos sus derechos ciudadanos de por vida por delitos considerados traici√≥n a la patria.
Esa condena fue dictada un d√≠a despu√©s de que √Ålvarez rechaz√≥ subirse a un avi√≥n que lo iba a llevar, junto con otros 222 excarcelados pol√≠ticos nicarag√ºenses, hacia Estados Unidos, lo que provoc√≥ la indignaci√≥n del presidente Ortega, quien en una cadena nacional lo calific√≥ de ‚Äúsoberbio‚Äù, ‚Äúdesquiciado‚Äù y ‚Äúenerg√∫meno‚Äù.
Las relaciones del Gobierno de Daniel Ortega y la Iglesia cat√≥lica viven momentos de gran tensi√≥n, marcadas por la expulsi√≥n y encarcelamiento de sacerdotes, la prohibici√≥n de actividades religiosas y la suspensi√≥n de sus relaciones diplom√°ticas.
El Gobierno de Nicaragua excarcel√≥ en octubre pasado a 12 sacerdotes y los envi√≥ al Vaticano, aunque entre esos religiosos no se encontraba el obispo √Ålvarez.
Nicaragua atraviesa una crisis desde abril de 2018, que se ha acentuado tras las elecciones de noviembre de 2021, en las que Ortega fue reelegido para un quinto mandato, cuarto consecutivo y segundo junto a su esposa, Rosario Murillo, como vicepresidenta, con sus principales contendientes en prisi√≥n.
EFE

author: PA News Agency
title: Dublin is safe compared to other western cities, Varadkar insists | Warrington Guardian
text: Dublin is a safe city when compared with others in the western world, the Taoiseach has insisted. Leo Varadkar said while it is important to acknowledge and listen to the experiences of those who have fallen victim to crime in Dublin, he insisted such incidents are not the norm for Ireland‚Äôs capital. There has been an increased focus on safety in Dublin following a series of well publicised random attacks and assaults on people in the city. That scrutiny intensified after the events of November 23, when rioting broke out in the city centre following a knife attack on three young children and their care assistant outside a primary school. Opposition parties claim a reduction in Garda numbers has contributed to a situation where parts of the city are no longer safe. It is a charge the Government has rejected. Mr Varadkar was asked about the issue of safety in Dublin at his end of year media briefing with political journalists. ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs no city that‚Äôs 100% safe,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúIf you look at something like the murder rate, for example, in Ireland or Dublin, compare that to other countries or other major cities, you‚Äôll see that Dublin and Ireland are relatively safe relative to other countries and other cities in the western world. ‚ÄúBut there‚Äôs no place that‚Äôs 100% safe and I acknowledge that. What I say to people is that we‚Äôre taking actions in all of these areas, increasing Garda numbers and Garda resources, making our laws tougher, with tougher sentences in particular, appointing more judges, expanding our prison places. ‚Äú(There is) also a big focus now on community safety partnerships, because it can‚Äôt be all just about a law and order response. Other things are important too, including things like street lighting, like cameras, like engaging with different services around addiction and mental health and so on. That‚Äôs the approach that we‚Äôre taking.‚Äù Asked how he responded to accounts from individuals who have been assaulted in the capital, the Taoiseach added: ‚ÄúOf course I am concerned about individual negative experiences that people have in Dublin or anywhere else. That‚Äôs something you‚Äôre very aware of and very exposed to as a politician. ‚ÄúSomebody would have maybe a very bad experience of our health service. But I‚Äôm also aware of the counterfactual or the other sides of the story, if you‚Äôd like, the huge number of people who have a very positive experience of our health service, for example and say so when surveyed. ‚ÄúThe same thing applies to people coming into town, coming into our cities and coming into our country. ‚ÄúMost people, thankfully, don‚Äôt experience being victims of violent crime in Dublin or anywhere else. ‚ÄúWhile it‚Äôs really important that we listen to and acknowledge the stories of people who have a very bad experience, we have a responsibility as politicians and journalists not to make the mistake of thinking that bad experiences are the majority or are the norm.‚Äù Comments: Our rules We want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. The ability to comment on our stories is a privilege, not a right, however, and that privilege may be withdrawn if it is abused or misused. Please report any comments that break our rules. [Read the rules here](/misc/comments)

author: Thrivetime Show
title: ReAwaken America Tour | Joe Allen | Understanding Yuval Noah Harari, Klaus Schwab & The Self-Proclaimed Elites‚Äô Transhumanism Agenda
text:
The ReAwaken America Tour Heads to the Home of Lockdowns, Motown (Detroit, Michigan) & It's Going to Be Profound (June 7th & 8th 2024) | Join General Flynn, Eric & Lara Trump, Kash Patel, Dr. Stella, Mel K & Team America | June 7-8 2024
